tree.train

Class Entropy

  • java.lang.Object
    • tree.train.Entropy

  • public class Entropy
extends java.lang.Object
    Used for calculating information theory metrics used for determining the best splits in a decision tree.
    Author:
    Matthew Bernstein - matthewb@cs.wisc.edu

    • Method Detail

      • informationGain

        public static java.lang.Double informationGain(DataSet data,
                               Split split)
        Calculate the information gain of the class attribute on a given split. A split consists of an attribute and a set of instances. This method calculates

        H(C) - H(C | X)

        where H(C) is the entropy of the class attribute and H(C | X) is the conditional entropy of the class attribute given some other attribute, X
        Parameters:
        data - the data set
        split - a split on the data
        Returns:
        the information gained on the dataset's class attribute by knowing the split

      • entropy

        public static java.lang.Double entropy(DataSet data)
        Calculate the entropy of the class attribute in a data set. This method calculates

        H(C)

        where C is the class attribute
        Parameters:
        data - the data set for which to calculate entropy
        Returns:
        the entropy of the class attribute

      • conditionalEntropy

        public static java.lang.Double conditionalEntropy(DataSet data,
                                  Split split)
        Calculate the conditional entropy of the class attribute given another attribute. That is, this method calculates

        H(C | X)

        where C is the class attribute and X is some other attribute in the data set.
        Parameters:
        data - the data set
        split - the split of the attribute for which we condition the class attribute
        Returns:
